Systemd is like Linux's manager that starts all the programs when the computer boots up. It's like a conductor saying 'First start this, then start that, if this crashes restart it.' We secure the conductor!

In this lesson, we'll learn about systemd security on linux in a way that makes sense. We'll start simple, use real examples, and build your understanding step by step. By the end, you'll understand the core ideas and why they matter!
